10.name: Water Reservoir
10.description: A dam or river where water is stored and regulated for use in the hydroelectric power plant

20.1.name: Trash Rack
20.1.description: Filters out debris from the water

30.name: Penstock
30.description: Pipeline that carries water from the intake structure to the turbine

40.name: Turbine
40.description: Converts the kinetic energy of water into mechanical energy

40.1.name: Runner
40.1.description: The rotating part of the turbine that interacts with the water flow

40.2.name: Guide Vanes
40.2.description: Directs water flow onto the runner blades

40.3.name: Shaft
40.3.description: Transfers mechanical energy from the turbine to the generator

40.4.name: Hub
40.4.description: Connects the runner blades to the shaft

40.4.1.name: Blade Seals
40.4.1.description: Seals the gap between the hub and the runner blades

40.4.2.name: Pitch Control Mechanism
40.4.2.description: Controls the angle of the runner blades

50.name: Generator
50.description: Converts mechanical energy into electrical energy

60.name: Transformer
60.description: Increases or decreases the voltage of the generated electricity for long-distance transmission and distribution

70.name: Control Systems
70.function: Monitor and control various parameters of the power plant
70.description: Maintain efficiency and safety within the plant

80.1.name: Circuit Breakers
80.1.description: Ensure proper functioning and protection of the system

80.2.name: Switches
80.2.description: Ensure proper functioning and protection of the system

80.3.name: Electrical Equipment
80.3.description: Ensure proper functioning and protection of the system

90.name: Tailrace
90.description: Discharges water back into the river after passing through the turbine

100.name: Auxiliary Systems
100.description: Support the main components of the hydroelectric power plant

100.1.name: Cooling
100.1.description: Supports the main components by providing cooling

100.2.name: Lubrication
100.2.description: Supports the main components by providing lubrication

100.3.name: Ventilation
100.3.description: Supports the main components by providing ventilation

100.4.name: Fire Protection
100.4.description: Supports the main components by providing fire protection

100.5.name: Emergency Power
100.5.description: Supports the main components by providing emergency power
